member.name: M:SpotifyNet.Spotify.PausePlayback(System.String)
member.summary: Pause playback on the user’s account.
member.param: The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.
member.returns: A completed request will return a response code, and then issue the command to the player. Due to the asynchronous nature of the issuance of the command, you should use the Get Information About The User’s Current Playback endpoint to check that your issued command was handled correctly by the player. If the device is not found, the request will return response code. If the user making the request is non-premium, a response code will be returned.

member.summary: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user’s active device.

member.name: M:SpotifyNet.Spotify.StartResumePlayback(System.String,SpotifyNet.Model.Player.Offset,System.Nullable{System.UInt32},System.String)
member.summary: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user’s active device.
member.param: Spotify URI of the context to play. Valid contexts are albums, artists, playlists.
Indicates from where in the context playback should start. Only available when corresponds to an album or playlist object.
Indicates from what position to start playback. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.
The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.
member.returns: A completed request will return a response code, and then issue the command to the player. Due to the asynchronous nature of the issuance of the command, you should use the Get Information About The User’s Current Playback endpoint to check that your issued command was handled correctly by the player. If the device is not found, the request will return response code. If the user making the request is non-premium, a response code will be returned.

member.summary: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user’s active device.
member.param: A array of the Spotify track URIs to play.
Indicates from where in the context playback should start.
Indicates from what position to start playback. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.
The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.
member.returns: A completed request will return a response code, and then issue the command to the player. Due to the asynchronous nature of the issuance of the command, you should use the Get Information About The User’s Current Playback endpoint to check that your issued command was handled correctly by the player. If the device is not found, the request will return response code. If the user making the request is non-premium, a response code will be returned.

member.name: M:SpotifyNet.Spotify.StartResumePlayback(System.String,System.String[],SpotifyNet.Model.Player.Offset,System.Nullable{System.UInt32},System.String)
member.summary: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user’s active device. Only one of either or can be specified. If neither is present, calling will resume playback. If both are present the request will return . If is a Playlist or Album, or when is provided, then can be added to specify starting track in the context. If the provided corresponds to an album or playlist object, an can be specified either by OR position.If both are present the request will return . If incorrect values are provided for or , the request may be accepted but with an unpredictable resulting action on playback.
member.param: Spotify URI of the context to play. Valid contexts are albums, artists, playlists.
A array of the Spotify track URIs to play.
Indicates from where in the context playback should start. Only available when corresponds to an album or playlist object, or when the parameter is used.
Indicates from what position to start playback. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.
The id of the device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user’s currently active device is the target.
member.returns: A completed request will return a response code, and then issue the command to the player. Due to the asynchronous nature of the issuance of the command, you should use the Get Information About The User’s Current Playback endpoint to check that your issued command was handled correctly by the player. If the device is not found, the request will return response code. If the user making the request is non-premium, a response code will be returned.
